title: Nigeria Three Month Interbank Rate (Nibor)
description: Nigeria Three Month Interbank Rate (Nibor) was at 15 percent on Thursday November 10. Interbank Rate in Nigeria averaged 12.87 percent from 2007 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 38.96 percent in September of 2013 and a record low of 0 percent in November of 2017. The interbank rate is the rate of interest charged on short-term loans made between banks in the local currency. This page provides - Nigeria Interbank Rate- actual values, historical data, forecast, chart, statistics, economic calendar and news.
author: Central Bank of Nigeria
